Obviously not top 3 or anything for supports, but I've played him in ranked bot lane with success, more so last season, as I haven't played a ton of ranked this season.

hes in no means bad, but then again brand isnt bad either. If you can skillfully dodge Vel's Q (which is harder the closer you are) and manage to avoid a passive proc then you as an adc have made vels advance and possibly retreat futile.

If a teammate says he is going Vel support, I ban Vel. Dude is trash tier support lol.

Velkoz has an AoE knock up/back which is pretty much the same CC as Alistar has with his W +Q combo...
Velkoz also has a slow and his passive damage on rely on levels not on gold/items

Not only that, but his slow is attached to a really powerful poke. Vel'koz can grab Liandry's and immediately be relevant in terms of damage (especially when he ults.... goddamn).

Team comp is always important but the benefit of taking Vel'Koz support is that it basically means you have a bonus midlaner.

Liandries isn't the best before later on in the game (the stats it gives isn't the best and the burn doesn't get meaningful before later on in the game where the enemy is likely to have more HP... and they are also likely to have more HP left after getting hit by one of your spells)

Though haunting guise is pretty good I believe... as I think Vel'koz has a pretty good base damage and magic pen is a good and cheap way to abuse base damages when you don't have access to much gold (like if you want to deal damage with Zyra you could build haunting guise and sorc shoes and you would have pretty good damage for a rather low cost.. and eventually you could try to get liandries + rylais for more survivability and damage... Zyra plants have an insane base damage of something like 120 damage per hit at level 18 and you can have 2+ plants and ult gives them more attack speed)

That's pretty much what I meant, though. You never want to rush a damage item as a support champ - you need to buy wards, upgrade your gold item, get sightstone, etc - but then once you have all the support basics, you can branch out a bit, and Vel'koz can become an impactful damage dealer with just one inventory slot even if nothing else has gone right all game.

It's an expensive item for a support to go for but luckily it builds out of Haunting Guise, which - like you mentioned - is pretty nice on him already.

Edit: It's 250 Gold, It's not that much, It means 2-3 wards on the map from JUST you at all times, Vision gets you kills, Protects dragon/baron, Allows possible steals. Prevents ganks... I can go on but i don't think you'll learn anything from it.

This means you will (With correct ward placement) Have vision of around 80% of the map. But oh you're right, That 250 gold for wards isn't worth anything.

If your saying that vision is costing me games then your wrong.

My enemies having huge gold advantages over me is what is costing games, and spending my precious coins on wards is only going to increase the gold discrepancy.

Gee i wonder why they get a gold advantage, Maybe because you didn't have a ward to stop those 40,000 ganks. 

Perhaps they got a early dragon while you were not looking, Oh i don't know Maybe just maybe you're losing jungle camps all game, And getting caught out. But those little green things wouldn't do anything to stop that, Naaa Couldn't be. 

I'll bet you $10,000 I could have that account in silver in under a week.  Using wards.

You know so when my bronzey team see's a 5 man gank coming they can run away, Preventing the gank, And keeping that gold lead away.

The game is complicated enough. I'm just starting to understand the finer mechanics of the game, no need to suddenly add another giant layer of complexity by telling me warding is necessary. Farming, last-hitting, trading, and positioning are hard enough to all manage at the same time as it is. Now you want me to constantly ward at the same time?

Lead by example. When I do ward, it sure as hell isn't in the games where our support has built a soulstealer instead of a sightstone. If I get a good pick because someone placed a ward in a nice spot, I recognize that and start realizing how useful wards are, and proceed to buy a few myself.

I specifically remember a game where I was sion top. Our support couldn't be bothered to upgrade her trinket, let alone build an SS, I kindly requested that she buys sightstone because we needed vision, she ignored me. So i took initiative and built a sightstone and started warding. At the post game screen half the enemy team was laughing at me, calling me an idiot for buying sightstone, telling me that buying SS was the reason i lost. That was the day i stopped seriously warding as anyone other than the support.

First off 
" If I get a good pick because someone placed a ward in a nice spot, I recognize that and start realizing how useful wards are, and proceed to buy a few myself."

You should not have to get a kill because of a ward, BEFORE.

Second i stated at level 9 you should upgrade you trinket for 250 gold. It's not much.

I NEVER said the whole team should spend 1600 gold on a sight stone. I said SPEND 250 GOLD

It's not much gold, It gives you 2-3 wards AT ALL TIMES. It's well worth the cost. 

1 ward = 75 gold. 

Upgrade trinket costs 250 gold

So, If you place 3-4 wards with that trinket IT HAS BEEN PAID FOR.


Last 
"The game is complicated enough. I'm just starting to understand the finer mechanics of the game, no need to suddenly add another giant layer of complexity by telling me warding is necessary. "

Yes it's necessary, you HAVE TO WARD.

A tank Fizz would have a word with you on that one. That little fish can cause all sorts of problems.
Galio can also carry from support if given a few kills. He builds off-tank by default so no real hardship there.

Most normal support tanks though I'd agree with having issues trying to carry. Though there are others remaining that I've not mentioned yet like Volibear who under the correct circumstances can really ruin somebody's day.

If i'm a tank support and get fed, i start building damage anyway after 1-2 tank items. Hexdrinker or sheen for Leona (or sunfire cape), Iceborn Gauntlet for blitzcrank, maybe black cleaver, statikk or botrk for thresh, wit's end for braum, things like these ^^
My tank Leona can and has stolen a lot of kills with her shield explosion. Other than that...yeah.

Happens to me all the time lol. It's not too rare that I get a random double kill in fights lol. Something about that 3 second delay is just the right time to steal some kills after teammates have unloaded their stuff.
If support Lux, you already have sightstone, and start building pure AP after that, then yeah, its totally doable. xD
